alert.note: Alert for Eastern Will; Grundy; Kendall; La Salle; Northern Will; Southern Cook; Southern Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 4:21AM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow, strong winds, and dangerous travel conditions expected through early to mid morning. Another period of accumulating snow is expected late this afternoon and tonight. Total snow accumulations from both periods of snow of 4 to 8 inches expected. Wind gusts to around 45 mph expected after midnight tonight. * WHERE...La Salle, Kendall, Grundy, Southern Cook, and Will counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact today`s morning commute and possibly the evening commute as well. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will mix with and may change entirely to rain from mid morning to mid afternoon, leading to some melting and compaction of the snow that falls this morning. Rain will change back to snow late this afternoon. Snow rates may exceed 1 inch per hour at times. Westerly wind gusts in excess of 45 mph are expected primarily this evening and overnight and may lead to areas of blowing snow and very low visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Will; Grundy; Kendall; La Salle; Northern Will; Southern Cook; Southern Will
